hadiths.arabicText: إِنَّمَا الأَعْمَالُ بِالنِّيَّاتِ، وَإِنَّمَا لِكُلِّ امْرِئٍ مَا نَوَى، فَمَنْ كَانَتْ هِجْرَتُهُ إِلَى دُنْيَا يُصِيبُهَا أَوْ إِلَى امْرَأَةٍ يَنْكِحُهَا فَهِجْرَتُهُ إِلَى مَا هَاجَرَ إِلَيْهِ
hadiths.englishText: The reward of deeds depends upon the intentions and every person will get the reward according to what he has intended. So whoever emigrated for worldly benefits or for a woman to marry, his emigration was for what he emigrated for.
hadiths.commentary: This hadith emphasizes the importance of sincerity in all actions. It teaches that the acceptance of deeds by Allah depends on the intention behind them. This is one of the most fundamental hadiths in Islamic jurisprudence.

hadiths.arabicText: بُنِيَ الإِسْلاَمُ عَلَى خَمْسٍ: شَهَادَةِ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا رَسُولُ اللَّهِ، وَإِقَامِ الصَّلاَةِ، وَإِيتَاءِ الزَّكَاةِ، وَالحَجِّ، وَصَوْمِ رَمَضَانَ
hadiths.englishText: Islam is built upon five pillars: testifying that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, establishing prayer, paying zakah, performing Hajj, and fasting in Ramadan.
hadiths.commentary: This fundamental hadith outlines the five essential practices that form the foundation of Islamic faith and practice.

hadiths.arabicText: الْمُؤْمِنُ مَنْ أَمِنَهُ النَّاسُ عَلَى دِمَائِهِمْ وَأَمْوَالِهِمْ
hadiths.englishText: The believer is one from whom people are safe regarding their blood and wealth.
hadiths.commentary: This hadith defines true faith through practical behavior - a believer is recognized by their trustworthiness and the safety others feel around them.

hadiths.chapter: Loving for others what you love for yourself
hadiths.arabicText: لاَ يُؤْمِنُ أَحَدُكُمْ حَتَّى يُحِبَّ لأَخِيهِ مَا يُحِبُّ لِنَفْسِهِ
hadiths.englishText: None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.
hadiths.commentary: This hadith establishes the principle of brotherhood and selflessness as a requirement of true faith. It encourages Muslims to wish well for others as they wish for themselves.

hadiths.arabicText: مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الآخِرِ فَلْيَقُلْ خَيْرًا أَوْ لِيَصْمُتْ
hadiths.englishText: Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him speak good or remain silent.
hadiths.commentary: This hadith teaches the importance of controlling one's tongue. It is part of a longer hadith that also mentions honoring guests and neighbors.
Similar to Bukhari's version, emphasizing the critical importance of intention in Islam.

hadiths.arabicText: الإِيمَانُ بِضْعٌ وَسَبْعُونَ شُعْبَةً، أَعْلاَهَا قَوْلُ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ، وَأَدْنَاهَا إِمَاطَةُ الأَذَى عَنِ الطَّرِيقِ، وَالْحَيَاءُ شُعْبَةٌ مِنَ الإِيمَانِ
hadiths.englishText: Faith has over seventy branches. The highest is the declaration that there is no god but Allah, and the lowest is removing harmful objects from the road. And modesty is a branch of faith.
hadiths.commentary: This hadith shows that faith encompasses many aspects of life, from major declarations of belief to simple acts of kindness in daily life.

hadiths.arabicText: يَا عِبَادِي إِنِّي حَرَّمْتُ الظُّلْمَ عَلَى نَفْسِي وَجَعَلْتُهُ بَيْنَكُمْ مُحَرَّمًا فَلاَ تَظَالَمُوا
hadiths.englishText: O My servants, I have forbidden oppression for Myself and have made it forbidden amongst you, so do not oppress one another.
hadiths.commentary: This is part of the famous Hadith Qudsi (divine hadith) where Allah speaks directly. It establishes justice as a core divine principle.

hadiths.englishText: The best among you are those who have the best manners and character.
hadiths.commentary: This hadith highlights the importance of good character and manners in Islam, showing that excellence in faith is reflected in how one treats others.

hadiths.arabicText: مَا نَقَصَتْ صَدَقَةٌ مِنْ مَالٍ وَمَا زَادَ اللَّهُ عَبْدًا بِعَفْوٍ إِلاَّ عِزًّا وَمَا تَوَاضَعَ أَحَدٌ لِلَّهِ إِلاَّ رَفَعَهُ اللَّهُ
hadiths.englishText: Charity does not decrease wealth. No one forgives except that Allah increases his honor. And no one humbles himself for the sake of Allah except that Allah raises his status.
hadiths.commentary: This hadith encourages charity, forgiveness, and humility by assuring believers that these virtues lead to increase, not decrease.

hadiths.arabicText: مَنْ أَحَبَّ أَنْ يُبْسَطَ لَهُ فِي رِزْقِهِ وَيُنْسَأَ لَهُ فِي أَثَرِهِ فَلْيَصِلْ رَحِمَهُ
hadiths.englishText: Whoever would like his provision to be increased and his lifespan to be extended, let him maintain family ties.
hadiths.commentary: This hadith emphasizes the importance of maintaining family relationships and the blessings that come from doing so.

hadiths.arabicText: انْظُرُوا إِلَى مَنْ أَسْفَلَ مِنْكُمْ وَلاَ تَنْظُرُوا إِلَى مَنْ هُوَ فَوْقَكُمْ فَهُوَ أَجْدَرُ أَنْ لاَ تَزْدَرُوا نِعْمَةَ اللَّهِ
hadiths.englishText: Look at those who are below you and do not look at those who are above you, for it is more likely that you will not belittle Allah's blessings upon you.
hadiths.commentary: This hadith teaches contentment and gratitude by advising believers to compare their situation with those less fortunate rather than the wealthy.

hadiths.englishText: Pray as you have seen me praying.
hadiths.commentary: This hadith establishes the Prophet's prayer as the model for all Muslims to follow in their worship.

hadiths.arabicText: طَلَبُ الْعِلْمِ فَرِيضَةٌ عَلَى كُلِّ مُسْلِمٍ
hadiths.englishText: Seeking knowledge is an obligation upon every Muslim.
hadiths.commentary: This hadith establishes that acquiring knowledge is not optional but a religious duty for every Muslim, male and female.

hadiths.arabicText: مَا أَعْطِيَ أَحَدٌ عَطَاءً خَيْرًا وَأَوْسَعَ مِنَ الصَّبْرِ
hadiths.englishText: No one has been given a gift better and more comprehensive than patience.
hadiths.commentary: This hadith highlights patience as the greatest gift a person can receive, emphasizing its importance in dealing with life's trials.
